hypothesis_content.title: Bull Regime Defense at Weekly Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP)
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BULL regime, a pullback that drives the price down to test the rising weekly (1W) VWAP from above, coinciding with a spike in the put/call volume ratio (PCR) to > 1.2 (fear), presents a high-probability long entry for regime continuation. The bounce will typically regain the prior weekly high within 8 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a sustained bull regime, the rising weekly VWAP acts as a dynamic major support level. A test combined with elevated put buying (high PCR) indicates panic selling by weak hands to informed buyers, while normalized funding shows leverage has been flushed. This creates a favorable risk/reward long setup for the prevailing trend to resume.
entry_conditions: BTC price pulls back to within 1% of the 1W VWAP
Daily Put/Call Volume Ratio (derivatives) > 1.2 on the test day
Funding rates turn neutral or slightly negative (between -0.005% and 0.005%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches the weekly high established prior to the pullback
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the 1W VWAP by more than 3%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The probability of the price closing below the entry stop-loss level within the 8-day period exceeds 40%, or the average time to reach the take-profit target is greater than 8 days in more than 60% of cases.
